text: 18.36 In relation to Part 1(b), the starting point for all development proposals will be no net loss of open space, and any development proposal resulting in an increase in population will be required to provide an amount of open space in accordance with the principles set out 18.37 in Policy BO1. However, there may be certain circumstances (e.g. in housing estate regeneration schemes) where building on fragmented, unused, and poor quality open space enables the provision of a larger, consolidated, and enhanced area of open space which is more usable for the local community and provides better urban greening and biodiversity outcomes than the existing open space. 18.38 For a net loss of open space to be considered, the development proposal must demonstrate it will achieve the above by successfully consolidating smaller and less functional areas into a larger open space Tower Hamlets Local Plan 317 BIODIVERSITY AND OPEN SPACE
